diagnostic_tests.diagnostic_finding: As indicated for major depressive disorder

when_to_see_doctor_urgently: seek immediate medical attention if condition worsens

other_options: bupropion XL 150mg daily, titrate to 300mg (if fatigue/no anxiety)
mirtazapine 15mg at bedtime, titrate to 30-45mg (if insomnia/poor appetite)

treatment_protocol.duration: continue for at least 6-12 months after remission
treatment_protocol.monitoring: assess every 1-2 weeks initially, then monthly
treatment_protocol.counseling: psychotherapy recommended in addition to medication

test_monitoring_schedule.HbA1c: every 3 months if not at goal, every 6 months if stable

when_to_see_doctor_urgently: severe hypoglycemia
diabetic ketoacidosis symptoms

initial_therapy.first_line: metformin 500mg twice daily with meals, titrate to 1000mg twice daily over 2-4 weeks

add_second_agent: liraglutide 0.6mg daily, titrate to 1.2-1.8mg (GLP-1 RA - if obesity/cardiovascular disease)
glipizide 5mg before breakfast (sulfonylurea - if cost issue)

HbA1c_very_high.consider_insulin: insulin glargine 10 units at bedtime, titrate by 2 units every 3 days

monitoring.HbA1c: every 3 months until at goal, then every 6 months

treatment_protocol.goal: HbA1c <7% for most, individualize based on patient factors

diagnostic_tests.diagnostic_finding: As indicated for deep vein thrombosis

when_to_see_doctor_urgently: seek immediate medical attention if condition worsens
seek immediate medical attention if condition worsens

outpatient_no_comorbidities.first_line: amoxicillin 1g three times daily for 7 days
outpatient_no_comorbidities.macrolide_option: azithromycin 500mg day 1, then 250mg daily for 4 days

outpatient_with_comorbidities.first_line: amoxicillin-clavulanate 875mg twice daily + azithromycin 500mg daily for 7 days

hospitalized.first_line: ceftriaxone 1-2g IV daily + azithromycin 500mg IV daily
hospitalized.severe: ceftriaxone 2g IV + azithromycin 500mg IV OR piperacillin-tazobactam + levofloxacin

treatment_protocol.follow_up: chest X-ray in 6 weeks if high risk

medications.drug_class: Herpes Simplex Virus Nucleoside Analog DNA Polymerase Inhibitor [EPC]

medications.pregnancy_category: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

special_populations.pregnancy: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

medications.pregnancy_category: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

special_populations.pregnancy: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

medications.generic_name: COLISTIN SULFATE, NEOMYCIN SULFATE, THONZONIUM BROMIDE AND HYDROCORTISONE ACETATE

medications.pregnancy_category: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

special_populations.pregnancy: category_D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks

precautions: monitor for side effects of medications

diet.meal_timing: regular meal schedule, avoid skipping meals

precautions: don't lie down immediately after eating
chew gum after meals to increase saliva

diet.fluid_restriction: may need fluid restriction in advanced stages

monitoring: regular blood tests for kidney function

lifestyle.environment: keep home clean, use air purifiers

precautions: rinse mouth after corticosteroid inhaler use

lifestyle.heat_cold_therapy: apply as needed for pain relief

lifestyle.exercise: 30 minutes most days, proven to help mood

precautions: seek help if suicidal thoughts occur

urinary tract infection.fluid_intake: drink plenty of water, 8-10 glasses daily

lifestyle.hygiene: wipe front to back, urinate after intercourse
lifestyle.clothing: wear cotton underwear, avoid tight pants
lifestyle.habits: don't hold urine for long periods

precautions: avoid bubble baths and harsh soaps

management.when_to_stop: if severe, bloody, or with fever

management.monitoring: check blood pressure - may indicate low BP
management.when_to_continue: mild dizziness that improves in 1-2 weeks
management.when_to_call_doctor: if severe, persistent, or with fainting

management.dental_care: maintain good oral hygiene to prevent cavities

statins.when_to_stop: if severe pain or dark urine (rhabdomyolysis)

management.not_dangerous: but can affect quality of life

management.consider_alternatives: discuss with doctor if significant gain

management.sleep_hygiene: regular schedule, avoid screens before bed
management.temporary_sleep_aid: melatonin or short-term hypnotic if needed

diabetes.HbA1c: every 3 months if not at goal, every 6 months if stable

hyperlipidemia.lipid_panel: 4-12 weeks after starting statin, then annually

thyroid_disorders.TSH: 6-8 weeks after dose change, then every 6-12 months

infections.urinary_tract_infection: repeat culture if symptoms persist after treatment
infections.pneumonia: chest X-ray in 6 weeks if high risk or slow resolution

warfarin_therapy.INR: weekly initially, then monthly when stable

avoid_in_children.aspirin: risk of Reye syndrome in viral illness
avoid_in_children.valproic acid: liver toxicity risk in under 2 years
